dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Framed in the large picture window stands JACK CARTER,  alone, looking out at the night. He turns away as the hea satin curtains close, wiping him from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blinding beam of light cuts across the room. One  pornographic slide after another hits the screen at the  opposite end of the room. They show a dowdy group in some anonymous bedroom, frozen in various stages of a sexual  orgy.  GERALD FLETCHER is slumped on a sofa. His young wife, ANN is curled up beside him.  SID FLETCHER, operating the projector's remote-control,  has the same flaccid appearance as his twin brother.  Jack Carter, drink in hand, watches from an armchair.  Clunk. Another slide hits the screen. Gerald is getting  turned on. He runs his hand along his wife's stockinged  leg. Anna shudders momentarily. She obviously finds his  touch repulsive. Carter watches Gerald's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (removing the cigar  from his mouth) Bollock naked with his socks still  on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) They do that up North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? Protective purposes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask Jack. It's his old stamping  ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter turns sharply away to the cocktail cabinet. Lights and sweet music happen when he opens it.  Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a bloody contortionist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still looking at the screen, Gerald continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want you to go up the  North, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Anna look at each other momentarily. There is  definitely something between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans) Not suede boots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off, Gerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? And get the clap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work for us, Jack. We have  connections in those parts.  I'd  hate you to screw 'em up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? A python.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid laughs raucously.  Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find out what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some hard nuts operate up there,  Jack. They won't take kindly to  someone from London poking his  bugle in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smell trouble, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law was satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when was that good enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clunk. The slide changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think again, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Express train plunges into a tunnel Blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compartment is full. Jack Carter sits in one corner,  reading a Raymond Chandler paperback, Farewell My Lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train speeds northwards. In the distance the stacks o a lonely power station belch a continuous stream of brown smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter steadies himself as he comes along the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive iron bridge crossing a river whips past. Its  mesh sides create an almost hypnotic effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter tips his head back and dispenses drops into his  nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train breaks from another tunnel. Evening light cuts  across the track as the train hurtles on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter pours himself a glass of water and takes out a sma phial of brown pills. He swallows one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chemical factory, brightly lit, passes by and the  outskirts of the city appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train moves slowly along the platform and stops. Cart collects his coat and briefcase from the rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is fairly deserted.   Carter exits with other passengers from the train. He pau and looks about before crossing to the pub opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of youths are playing records on the juke box. A old man sits in the corner reading a newspaper.   Carter enters through the swing door and a weedy BARMAN  comes to serve him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pint of bitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barman picks up a glass mug and begins to draw the  beer. Carter snaps his fingers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a thin glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barman sighs petulantly, transfers the beer into a  thin glass and puts it on the counter. A telephone rings. The second barman answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a Mr Carter in the room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks to the far end of the bar and picks up the  receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (pause) Margaret? (pause) Why the hell aren't you here? (he lights a  cigarette.) What time? (pause) Is Doreen at the house? (pause) Who's with him then? (pause) When can I see you? Will you be  there tomorrow? (pause) Now listen, Margaret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead. Carter hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A key hanging inside the letter box starts to move upward and out through the flap. A moment later, the door opens. Carter is standing at the bottom of a flight of stairs in a worker's terraced house. He closes the door and climbs  the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves cautiously. His eyes scan the peeling  wallpaper, the mildew on the banisters. A roof leak hits  an unseen bucket with depressing regularity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmade bed with pyjamas on it, a beaten-up wardrobe, a dressing table and chair are about it. Carter hears a  vehicle stopping on the street below. He eases back the  ancient net curtain. Two men in a Land Rover are looking  up. They see him and quickly drive off. Carter looks around the room. On top of the wardrobe ther an old shotgun. He reaches up and brings it down. Memorie flood back. He reaches up again and finds a box of  cartridges. More memories, jack and Frank grew up here. H leaves the gun on the bed and returns to the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. An overhead light snaps on to the face of a dead man FRAN CARTER. He is lying in a coffin. His eyes are closed, his skin made-up, like porcelain. Carter stands over the coffin. He gently touches his  brother's crossed hands and folds the shroud over his fac He exits, turning out the light and closing the door.  Darkness returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landlady, EDNA GARFOOT, is climbing the stairs. She's well built, sexy, experienced. Carter follows with his  baggage. He watches her appreciatively from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be using the room tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops and turns) I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying with a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing up the  stairs) Her husband docks tomorrow, does  he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's not like that, luv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and the light goes on. It's a big room  overlooking the road, furnished cheaply but comfortably.  Edna and Carter enter, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a traveller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveying the room) Will this do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Very nice. (He takes his wallet  out.) I'll pay you for tonight as  well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be bloody silly. You're the  first since Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter gives her the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling the mattress) I'll bet this one's seen some  action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter smiles and looks straight at her. Edna returns his look, dead pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you the key when you  come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves around the coffin as he shaves. His electric razor is plugged into the lamp above his dead brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffin lid is being screwed down.   Carter stirs a cup of instant coffee while watching the  undertakers at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he in bad shape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hearse is parked outside the row of terraced houses. youthful UNDERTAKER is minding it. He turns and looks  through the back window as a young girl walks up the stre DOREEN CARTER is sixteen and, like most girls of her age, tries to look older. She wears all the right gear but it' cheap and doesn't fit properly. Her long hair is lank.   There's something sad and embarrassing about her appearan The young undertaker watches as she enters Frank's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens slowly. Doreen stands there looking at the coffin. Carter sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems mesmerized by what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen doesn 't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been staying with a friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen nods. The undertaker coughs and thrusts another  screw into the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Doreen, did the police  say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed) They said he was drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young undertaker is still in the hearse listening to  the radio. In the driving mirror he sees the Land Rover  moving slowly tip the road. It stops by the house. Two me suss the scene and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working at Woolworths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Doreen look at each other awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you going to do? Live with  Margaret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen looks at him nervously, shakes her head and fumble in her bag for a cigarette. Carter continues, slightly indignant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why won't you come with us  to South America? My fiancee won't  mind, (pause) Your dad would have wanted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The undertaker puts the final screw in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to colleague) Get Hughbert up, will you? (to Carter) We're ready now, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The undertakers struggle with the coffin down the narrow  staircase into the street. Outside Carter and Doreen wait with two men. EDDIE APPLEYARD, a middle-aged man, is wear a shabby tweed suit, cap and black tie. KEITH LACEY is a  young barman who worked with Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't sure where it was taking  place, like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice of you to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Frank was a good bloke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windscreen of the following limousine Carter  can see his brother's coffin in the hearse as it moves  slowly through the streets of the city. Sitting in front  on fold-out seats are Eddie and Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe it when I heard.   Carter is suddenly attentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I was surprised when he  didn't turn up for work.  He was  always on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you work with him, Keith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Half Moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not to be left out) It's a bloody funny thing. You  know a bloke for six bloody years  and all the time he's as calm as  gentle Jesus... (pause) ...then he goes and does a thing  like that. (he shakes his head.) It's a bloody funny thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yeah. A bloody funny thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cortege drives into the crematorium, it passes the Land Rover parked outside. The same two men who passed  Frank's house are in it. A long and expensive-looking  funeral cortege passes out as they move up the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Doreen, Eddie and Keith are in the front pews fac the catafalque on which Frank's coffin rests. The vicar i already midway through the solemn words of the 'committal when a woman enters. The clunk of her high heels cuts  through the silence. Everybody looks round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Doreen) Is that Margaret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen nods. Frank's coffin sinks out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men in long grey coats wait in silence. The coffin  appears. Expertly, they take it and swing it on to a  trolley. They push it up the wide corridor towards the  furnace. One of the men starts whistling cheerfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET is thirtyish, blonde, attractive in a tarty kind of way.  Her heels are too high and she is wearing a chea pair of sunglasses. She walks quickly away, down the  cloisters, past the memorial tablets and urns.   Carter comes out of the chapel and sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret stops and looks round. Carter joins her.  I thou you weren't coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changed me mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They face each other in silence. Margaret looks past Cart and sees Doreen watching them at the end of the cloisters She turns away and starts walking slowly. Carter moves  with her.  Margaret continues nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyhing go off all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine... (pause) I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret stops in her tracks and looks back at Doreen.  She's still watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adamantly) She's nothing to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) What do you mean? You've been  Frank's bird ever since her mother  cleared off. You're closer to her  than anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) No. No. It's not like that. I've  got a husband, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret starts walking again, fast.   Carter catches hold of her arm and stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!   Hold it! (looking her in the  eye) Who killed Frank, Margaret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Killed?  I don't know anything  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves off rapidly. Carter catches up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must go. I'm in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret dithers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all right then. Twelve o'clock  on the Iron Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret walks off as calmly as she can, her high heels  clicking as she goes. Carter watches her disappear. Doree watches too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's coffin is slid inside the furnace. Flames start t lick it as the steel trap closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a large room with a horseshoe bar in the centre, a  real boozer.  A handful of hard drinkers are already in  position. Carter, Doreen, Keith and Eddie are sitting alone. Their  table is already covered with glasses. Doreen appears to  be slightly drunk on Babycham, Eddie on whisky and Keith  on beer. Carter is stone-cold sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absent friends. (He raises his glass  and drinks, then  continues  thoughtfully.) You don't think he might have done  it on purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You mean, like, kill himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Keith look at each other. Doreen watches them. She is getting very upset by the  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. Frank? Kill himself? You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stares at Keith, who is getting uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, what for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come off it. Frank was... well...  straight. He had no worries I know.  Hell, we worked together every day  for a year. It would have showed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just would. He was always the  same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when did he drink whisky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody seems to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen is now crying openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing off his  drink) Bloody good bloke. One of the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurts out) How would you know? (She suddenly jumps  up and empties her  glass in Eddie's  face.) Or you?  Or you? None of you knew.   I knew. He was me dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs off out of the door crying. Keith goes to follow Carter puts his hand out to restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go. She'll be OK. (to Eddie) Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping his face  with a handkerchief) Don't worry. She's bound to be  upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eddie) Have another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll be off now. I should be  at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stands up, cap in hand. Carter pulls out a wad of  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, look. (He peels off a  note.) Get your suit cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing, pushes  the note in his  top pocket) Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank was a good bloke. It's the  least I could have done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work here, Keith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter thinks for a moment, then leans forward to Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith, if anybody comes in here  and asks for me, you let me know.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the Las Vegas. Behind the  dance hall. (He casts an eye  around the bar.) Do you know a man called Albert  Swift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He comes in here a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would I find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today? At the races. He always  goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes out his phial of pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went to school with him. (smiles) He was leader of our gang. He'll  know what's going on in this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has just stopped. Bookies and punters lower thei umbrellas. Horses thunder towards the finishing post. Tur flies in all directions as the jockeys whip their mounts  in a last desperate effort and the crowd roars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert Swift is standing by a bookmaker's marking bis rac card with a biro. A hot dog is sticking out of his mouth, like a cigar. A man of about thirty-five, be appears much older, probably from an excess of booze and women. He loo up, and his mouth drops open, the hot dog falling to the  ground. He has seen Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is pushing his way along the line of bookies, all  the time looking about him. The track loudspeaker announc the winner of the last race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert pales. He holds his race card in front of his face and disappears into the crowd. As he moves off, his foot  steps on the hot dog and tomato ketchup oozes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stands alone, casting an eye over the punters. His eyes rest on someone the other side of the saddling ring  ERIC PAICE.  Dressed in a grey chauffeur's uniform, cap,  dark glasses and gloves, he is standing close to three  well-heeled-looking men with binoculars and shooting stic Horses for the next race are being led around the enclosu Carter approaches from behind. He looks at Eric closely  before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey suits you, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric swings round, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Eric. Eric Paice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing around here then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you know this is my home  town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes out his cigarettes. Eric takes one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. So what're you doing? On  your holidays?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm visiting relatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be. If they were still  living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bereavement. A death in the  family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter flicks bis lighter and gives Eric a, light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well. Small world, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very... (pause) So, who you working for these days  Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm straight. (indicating uniform) Respectable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) What are you doing? Advertising  Martini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've been watching television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, (pause) Come off it, Eric. Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always ad your welfare at  heart, Eric. Besides which, I'm  nosy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not always a healthy way to  be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you should know, if I remember  rightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A track announcement interrupts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're doing all right then,  Eric. You're making good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good prospects for advancement, is  there? A pension? (He can't resist it  any longer. He  lifts the sunglasses  off Eric's nose  and looks into his  eyes.) Do you know, I'd almost forgotten  what your eyes looked like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still the same. Piss holes  in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still got a sense of humour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I retained that, Eric. (He moves towards  the saddling ring  and turns to Eric.) Do you know a man called Albert  Swift, Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't say I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter looks across at the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't miss the start on my account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting gates slam open and the horses leap out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is driving along a country road. Ahead, two cars  are between him and a Cadillac with dark-tinted windows.  The Cadillac turns on to a minor road. Carter follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric Paice is driving. In the back sit the three men seen with him at the race track. The drinks compartment is ope and they are helping themselves to champagne. Racing resu come over the car radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter follows the Cadillac at a safe distance. It turns  into a driveway. Carter slows down and reads a sign by th entrance: The Heights.  He drives on and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter comes through a wooded area. He pauses by a lake,  now overgrown with weeds. A big man stands tossing stones into the water. Carter silently picks up a dead branch  then runs at the man. Carter whacks him on the head and h collapses unconscious into the lake. Carter moves on towa the house. MARTY and RAY the two men previously seen in  the Land Rover, are playing with an Alsatian on the spaci lawn fronting the house. It's a Victorian building  surrounded by acres of woodland. Carter breaks from the trees and darts for the side door. One of the men notices and shouts after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter runs into the house and slips into a small service room. Ray and then Marty charge inside but miss seeing  Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A game of poker is in progress. Seated around the table  are the three men with Eric at the race track. With them  is an elegant man, CYRIL KINNEAR. On the sofa are GLENDA, a sexy-looking young woman, and Eric Paice. Ray bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks past Ray, blowing him a kiss. Kinnear watches with some amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what it's like these days,  Jack.  You can't get the material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter looks at Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can see your problem, Mr  Kinnear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Jack, (pause) I could weep. I really could.   Sometimes I think I'll retire.  Just piss off to the Bahamas and  let somebody else employ them, (to girl) Glenda, get Jack a drink. What is  it, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Glenda) Scotch, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bouncer) Piss off, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray closes the door behind him. Glenda brings Carter his Scotch. He looks at her as she  sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric told me of your bereavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know, I never knew he worked  in one of my places!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Funny that. Neither did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd known, I'd have fixed him  up with something better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the three men sitting around the table with Kinnea gets impatient. PETER, LES AND HARRY are well-heeled, mid aged, northern businessmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we here to play cards or talk  about the old days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry! Jack, I don't want to be  rude, but these men have brought a  lot of money with them. Glenda,  you don't offer a man like Jack a  drink in those piddling little  glasses.  Give him the bloody  bottle. (He picks up his  cards.) Now, where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry keeps a cold, wary eye on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I think I'll stay as I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) You're bluffing, you bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you pay to find out.  Right, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. If you can afford it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carter) Thought you were going soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. When you've lost your money.  Won't take long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clever sod, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only comparatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, I don't like to push, but  could you let us know how much  your hand's worth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at his cards. Glenda tucks her legs up, makin sure that Carter gets an eyeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Sid Fletcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Sid Fletcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter looks back at the table. Kinnear pushes in some  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? A hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hundred, and another hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear lays more cash on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, Harry? That's another hundred -  twenty-five pounds notes of the  realm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred altogether?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred altogether, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda attracts Carter's attention again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid Fletcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sending her up) Oh, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumb) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, do you really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter turns to the table yet again. Harry nervously puts another hundred on the table. Kinnea purses his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll follow that and go two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can always see me, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sweats and then smiles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises an eyebrow) Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear takes a wad of notes out of his pocket. Glenda,  shifts herself on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I met him last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. When he came up on business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to see Mr Kinnear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, getting bored, looks back at the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicking) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's six hundred pounds, Harry.  Two hundred to follow you, and  I've raised it four hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sweats some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not seeing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry smiles nervously. He counts some money out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calling my bluff, are you, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry nods. Glenda speaks, but this time Carter keeps his eyes on the table. Kinnear lays out his hand  a hearts flush, queen high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went about together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, while he was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he was here. You went about  together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was here for four days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you do me a favour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll do you a favour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you please put my glass on  the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter smiles and does just that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Harry. I haven't won,  have I? Go on, you're pulling my  leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear leans across to pick up Harry's cards. Harry grab them and puts them in the pack. Kinnear turns to Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that, Jack?  Old Harry  thought I was having him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter gets up from the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not going, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to. Things to see to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course. Well, any  time, just drop by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll do that. (He points at Harry.) Told you it wouldn't take long,  didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric opens the door and follows him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! I didn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have told me who you  were working for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyril didn't like it, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Cyril, eh? So it's all girls  together, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's thinking Sid and Gerald won't  like it much when they hear you've  been sticking your nose in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter carries on walking to the front door. He opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. Tell him to save the  cost of the phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter leaves. Eric signals Ray to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge metal claw catches hold of an old car and lifts it  like it was a toy. The yard is beside the River Tyne. In  the distance a train crosses the Iron Bridge. Carter is examining a beaten-up Hillman when the yard own BILLY LAWS, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to this car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it got to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my brother's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he drove it into the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the steering faulty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the brakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Nowt wrong with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it happen, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was drunk. Drunk as a lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, busty pub singer is performing on the small stage. A trio on her right plays a good, grinding, up-tempo numb Carter comes through the door. He pushes his way through  the packed drunken crowd to the bar. Keith serves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you having, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter watches the singer. The customers cheer and whistl Keith returns with the Scotch. He looks nervously around  and speaks to Carter quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard of a man called Thorpe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Thorpey? Haven't seen him in a  long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up Carter's  money) That's what he was saying about  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith takes the money to the till. The music grinds away. Keith returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he'd heard you were up in  town. Wondered if I knew where you  was staying. Wanted to look you  up. Old time's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. What'd you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good lad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter watches the singer, then finishes his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Las Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter makes for the door. The singer is now moving throu the tables. She pauses to give some man a kiss. Everybody cheers. The woman sitting with the man snaps. She picks up his  glass of beer and throws it over the singer; then grabs  her hair and pulls her to the ground. Carter stops to watch. The two women roll on the floor,  punching and scratching. Carter smiles and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the corner is a neon-lit snack bar. Doreen and another young girl are sitting inside sucking milk shakes. Somewh a drunk is singing. His voice echoes up the alley. Carter draws alongside and notices Doreen. He stops and  watches her. She hasn't seen him so he goes to the window and knocks on it. She looks up and he beckons her outside Reluctantly, she comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) You all right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming to South America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's hurt and slightly irritated by this rejection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going to live, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At me friend's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilton Estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice family, are they? Church-goers  and all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm off tomorrow, so I don't  suppose I'll see you again. (He pulls out a wad  of money, and peels  off some notes.) There. Go and get your hair done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Can't believe it) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her chin with his finger and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be good. And don't trust boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doreen blushes and turns away. She rushes back to the sna bar with the money to show her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and Carter enters. Standing on the hall table is a small wooden casket with  an envelope taped to it. Carter pockets the envelope and  picks up the casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was left for you this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks past her into the sitting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he staying the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. (He puts the casket  on a side table.) Can I phone London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll cost you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is undressing. She's alone. Pulling the short black- silk underslip over her head, she stands in front of a  long mirror, clad only in black panties, bra and tights.  She looks at herself appreciatively. The phone rings. She flops on the bed and picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice speaks on the end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How I miss you. (She stretches  herself out sexily  and smiles.) Stop it, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cosy room. Carter is on the telephone. EDNA sits i a rocking chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Edna) I fancy you. I wish I was touching  you right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna turns towards him. Carter fixes her with his eyes.  Edna rocks herself gently. Carter continues softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...making love to you. I want to  stroke you and kiss you all over.  Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is lying full-length on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter speaks on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My black underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna rocks backwards and forwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) The sexy, silk ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna replies. He continues softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your bra off. (pause) No, go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna unhooks her bra. There's a flash of breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now hold them. Gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's hands cover her breasts. Her head moves slowly fro side to side, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly. Imagine it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna's hand caresses the inside of her leg. Her head roll from side to side slowly. She's breathing heavily. CROSS-CUT between Edna's head rocking backwards and forwa and Anna's head moving from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we're in South America, we'll  make love in the sun. Roll over...  and make love again... and again...  For me... I fancy you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the door opens and Gerald comes in. He sees Anna groaning on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You got gut  trouble or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna sits up abruptly and puts her hand over the receiver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, darling. Just doing some  exercises, (into telephone) Listen, Janet, Gerald's just got  in, so I must ring off. (pause) Yes. Yes. I'll come tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it till Sunday. I'll be back  then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter replaces the receiver. He still holds Edna's eyes. She rocks to and fro. The rocker creaks. The front door bell breaks the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter opens the door. Keith is outside. He's sweating.  His tie is somewhere round the back of his neck and his  suit is covered with dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpey. They were waiting for us  in the car park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter pulls Keith inside and turns out the light.  A Ford Zodiac comes along the road. It stops. Four faces  peer into the darkness where they're standing. Nobody get out. The back window winds down. Thorpe's nervous voice  floats out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like a word with you, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confidential, like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay in the car. I'll come and  listen. ( (He leaves the  darkness and walks  to the car.) What you want to tell me, Thorpey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpe holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been asked to give you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Carter a railway ticket. Carter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train goes at four minutes past  twelve. You've just got time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very kind of somebody. Who  do I have to thank? (pause) What  happens if I miss the train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been asked to make sure you  don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really. You're getting very  optimistic in your old age, aren't  you, Thorpey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the men inside mutters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's stop pissing about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming, Jack? It'd be best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter tears the ticket in half and drops it in the gutte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right lads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front passenger door starts to open. Carter grabs it  and pulls it wide open. With all his force, he slams it  against the man as he gets out. The window shatters over  his head. Blood spurts everywhere.  The driver panics. He accelerates away as the man in the back is getting out.  His foot is trapped in a safety belt. He's upended and  dragged along the tarmac, his head dangerously close to  the back wheel. His yells make the driver brake. In the  confusion Thorpe escapes from the car and makes off. Cart spots him and begins to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (roars) Thorpe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpe turns into the main road. He makes for the dance  hall and disappears inside. Carter follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dance floor is full, mainly with miniskirted girls,  their handbags at their feet. A rock band play mechanical music to match the dancing. Thorpe vanishes into the crowd circling the floor. Carter arrives. He scans the place, then sees Thorpe as he  disappears down into the gents' lavatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter enters. There's no sign of Thorpe. He checks the  cubicles until he finds the one that's occupied, then goe into the next one. He climbs on the seat and looks over  the partition. Thorpe is sitting down looking at the door Carter quietly leans across and pulls the chain. Thorpe  jumps up, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up, Thorpey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith kicks broken glass into the gutter while he waits.  Edna's next-door neighbour, an OLD WOMAN, watches. Carter and Thorpe come down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Keith, (pause) Stay there, Thorpey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knocks on Edna's door. It flies open. Edna is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the bloody hell do you think  you're at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Really, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come that bloody flannel  with me. If you're a traveller,  I'm bloody Twiggy. (She points at  Thorpe.) And who's he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? Have you no thought  for others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside? Why should I give house- room to your sort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the stairs, Keith. The door on  the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows you, Edna Garfoot.   Everybody knew there'd be trouble  when you moved in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Keith and Thorpe enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep your trap shut, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send my old man to see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And wouldn't he love it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, Thorpe and Keith are climbing the stairs. Carter  stops to pick up Frank's casket. Edna rushes in and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter opens the door to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go and make us all a  nice cup of tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter shoves Thorpe into the room.  Keith follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make us a nice cup of tea and I'll  tell you. I might even let you  watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (He knows she fancies  him) No, you won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter carefully places the casket on the chest of drawer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, Thorpey. It seems I've  got a secret benefactor. (He moves into the  room and opens his  briefcase, which  is lying on the  bed.) It's nice to know that. Isn't it,  Keith? (He takes out a  bottle of whisky.) There's only one trouble, I don't  know who to thank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpe looks longingly at the bottle of Scotch. Suddenly  Carter punches him hard in the stomach. He grunts and  collapses into a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I want to know who it is,  Thorpey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter tosses the whisky bottle to Keith and continues  wearily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. If you like, Thorpey,  we'll stop mucking about.  Somebody  doesn't want me poking my nose  into something and I happen to  know what that something is. (pause) Now stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpe looks at him, terrified. Slowly he stands. Carter  grabs him by the testicles and applies preasure. Thorpe  screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who paid you to see me off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't Jack. How can I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter applies more pressure. Thorpe screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't Jack, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who sent you, Thorpey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Brumby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter gives him a final squeeze and lets go. Thorpe groa and slips to the floor, doubled up in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, you see. Now you  could, couldn't you? (pause) And quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a knock on the door. Carter lets in Edna, who is  carrying the teatray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Edna, come in. Join the tea  set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Brumby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff Brumby. Ever been to Westsea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever been into an arcade there and  put a penny in the slot machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten to one, it belonged to Cliff  Brumby, and like as not the bloody  arcade as well. Right along the  coast. Isn't that right, Thorpey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpe drags himself painfully to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he living these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a new place at Burnham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Durham Road. The Pantiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Suppose you tell me what the bloody  hell's going on. It's my house,  you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Edna, and I must say you've  been great about the ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick the soft soap. Let's be having  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpe's plaintive voice interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be joking, (to Keith) Keep him away from the telephone.  I'm going out for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now just a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta-ra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let on I told you, for God's  sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter laughs and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a large, new, ranch-style house, set back from the  road. The front garden is a landscape gardener's nightmar with its phoney brick and wrought-iron wishing well,  porcelain dwarfs, lily pond, the lot. Fairy lights hang  over everything. There's a party going on. Lights are on in every room and the rock music is loud. The drive is lined with sports  cars. Carter parks and gets out. Out of a side door a young man stumbles towards the lily  pond.  There, he promptly throws up. Carter watches from behind a tree. His attention shifts to the white Bentley turning into th drive. It brakes sharply and the driver jumps out. CLIFF BRUMBY has been to a police ball. He is impeccably  dressed in tuxedo and white scarf. Now he's hopping mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus wept!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS BRUMBY cowers in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Cliff, don't get mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll murder the little bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby roars up to the front door, banging it furiously. young woman in a party dress, expecting to greet a  latecomer, is stunned to see who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, bloody Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't expecting you until three  o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is what you call having a  few friends back for coffee, is  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby pushes past her into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running bloody riot over my bloody  furniture, drinking my bloody  booze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest is lost as he disappears inside. He then powers  out through the side door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... spewing over my fucking  goldfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims a kick at the young man's backside, sending him  face-down into the lily pond. Mrs Brumby gets out of the car and hovers for a moment. A she approaches the house, people pour out. Brumby appears at the door with a boy pulling up his trousers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby throws the boy out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Phyllis. (He walks back into  the house.) Sandra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Brumby goes into the house and closes the door. Brumb passes an upstairs window as Sandra locks herself in a  bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra! Unlock the door, you bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter pauses outside the front door and listens to the  row going on upstairs. He opens the door and goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter passes silently through the hall into the large  sitting room. Mrs Brumby is sitting in an armchair.  Brumby is still yelling at his daughter upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Brumby jumps.  The front door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old friend of Cliff's. I  want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Brumby looks at her watch irritably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all about Cliff's business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves further into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, tell him the Fletchers  sent me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Brumby is uncertain what to do. Carter sits in an  armchair to make his point. She leaves. A moment later  Brumby storms into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the bloody hell's all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the bloody time is! (pause) It's two o'clock in the bloody  morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter still doesn 't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife says the Fletchers sent  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter just looks at him. Weighing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so bloody important it  couldn't wait till the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter starts to laugh. He realizes Thorpe has lied to  him.  Brumby isn't his man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm not in the mood for  bloody silly buggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby moves between him and the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I don't like it when some  hard nut comes pushing his way in  and out my house in the middle of  the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter again makes to leave. Brumby stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody well tell me who sent you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a big man, but you're in  bad shape. With me, it's a full- time job. Now behave yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby swings at him. Carter moves away from the punch,  then applies several sharp blows to Brumby's head and nec Brumby groans and collapses into the armchair, hurt. Carter walks into the hall and out of the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Mrs Brumby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks up the deserted street to Edna's place. He  finds the front door unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter enters cautiously. There is no sound. He closes th door quietly and pauses at the foot of the stairs. Still  there is no sound. He waits. A sudden rustle attracts his attention. Quietly, he moves to the sitting-room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter switches on the light. Edna is pressed against the far wall, holding a poker. Her dress is torn and her hair dishevelled. When she sees Carter, she sighs with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter helps himself to a glass of water from the tap.  Edna looks at her torn dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter puts the glass on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't care a stuff, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes out his phial of pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll buy you another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter swallows a pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the lad? They took him  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll they do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna rubs her wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bloody hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky. They kill as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking him) And what about you? Did you kill  Brumby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorpey nearly died laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Keith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Keith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pension him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) What am I supposed to do?  I don't  know where they've taken him. Do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that gun doing in your room?  Suppose I phoned the police and  told them there's a bloke staying  in my hotel who's planning to shoot  somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know I wouldn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) 'Cos I know you wear purple  underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes hold of her torn blouse and rips it open. Sh is wearing purple underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sunday morning. A girls' marching band rehearses on  the wasteground in front of the terraced houses. The Pela Hussars march back and forth carrying their proud banner, led by the drum majorette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the bed hangs a sign 'What would Jesus say?' In the bed lie Carter and Edna. The distant sound of the marchin band helps them surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be joking. I never eat  breakfast, (pause) Did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pelaw Hussars keep on marching. The back of their ban a stirring motto For Youth and Valour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm around her and moves on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the band executes another movement, a red Jaguar slide to a halt outside Edna's house. Two men get out. PETER th Dutchman and CON MCCARTY are definitely not local lads.  They look, and are, lethal. They try Edna's front door. I opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Are you tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not tired, (pause) Do you eat breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna laughs. They start to make love. Gently. Below the  undulating bedsprings rests a large chamberpot and, besid it, Carter's shotgun. Beyond is the bedroom door. It open slowly and the two men enter. Only their legs are visible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put us in it, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is off the bed, and Edna, in a flash. Edna screams and tries to stop the bedclothes following Carter on to  the floor. Peter and Con stand beside the bed smiling.  Peter is a queer and dressed fancy in a leather coat, wid bottomed trousers and a loud silk scarf. His hair is  bleached blond. Con is more traditional, more butch. He's in a camelhair overcoat, suit and tie. Both are in their  thirties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let us interrupt you, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have guessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about this. But there you  are. Orders are orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what orders would they be,  Con?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's hand runs over the carpet. It's going towards th chamber pot instead of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerald phoned us in the middle of  the night, said he'd heard you've  been making a nuisance of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to take you back to  London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it'd be doing him a big  favour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's hand finds the chamber pot and quickly moves on  towards the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know why you're all steamed up,  and so do Gerald and Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they have to be diplomatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter pulls out the gun and jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Now take me back to London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) It'd be best if you got dressed  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter moves around the bed towards them. He's naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it away, Jack. You know you  won't use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun he means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men are laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Con back down the stairs. Peter looks up at  Carter's cock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Anna could see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Jack. Be reasonable. You know  we're going to take you back -  sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con is the first to emerge from the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind you don't catch cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope she's got understanding  neighbours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Carter comes out, shotgun held across his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you when you've got your drawers  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman next door chooses that moment to come out  for her milk. As she straightens up, she sees Carter. The bottle flies from her hand and smashes on her doorstep.  Carter, never taking his eyes off Peter and Con, slowly  backs into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter watches from the window as he pulls on his jacket. The gun lies across the armchair. Outside, he can see Pet and Con talking by the Jaguar. Con exits. Edna, now in her dressing gown, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do us a favour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, and get myself beaten up  again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chance of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're friends of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that'll make me feel better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to get rough, do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter picks up the gun. He hands Edna, bis case and the  casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna comes out of the back gate into an alley, carrying  the casket and case. Con emerges from his hiding place  holding a handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! Where do you think you're  going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter appears from the gate next door, covering Con with the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strawberry Fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Con's handgun and signals him to go into Edna's  yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In.  Turn right.  (He points the gun  at the coalshed.) Open that door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con unbolts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con goes in. Carter closes and bolts the door. He moves  quickly back to Edna and the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to sit in the car and  whistle 'Rule, Britannia'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter jumps into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I stay away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car roars off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washing hangs behind each house as far as the eye can see Carter drives full tilt through it, collecting towels and sheets on the windscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coalhouse door is getting a terrible battering. It  finally gives and Con bursts out. He runs into the alley, following after Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's car screeches as it corners from the alley on to the road. Peter is leaning against the open door of the  Jaguar. When he sees Carter coming straight at him, he  scarpers for the pavement.  Carter hits the Jaguar's door at speed, tearing it off. It flies up and crashes on to  the tarmac as Carter careers over the wasteground. Soon h is out of sight. Con comes running. Peter is looking at the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con sees what's happened to the car and is not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bollocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter pulls up outside a house and gets out. He takes th washing off the car's bonnet, and throws it into a neglec garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter presses the bell. The door's opened by a young man SHAMIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Shamir watches Carter as he walks into the hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is his room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter enters and closes the door. Keith is in a had way, his face like a piece of raw steak. He is lying on a bed, still in the clothes of the night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith lifts his head painfully from the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they give you a rough time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (He lowers his head  to the pillow.) You bastard. You knew they'd come  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't, (pause) Does Albert Swift still live over  the ferry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get knotted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. All right. I want to  square things with you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes out of his wad of money. Keith's bloodshot  eyes watch him through the surrounding puff of flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuff it! My girl friend's coming  from Liverpool tonight.  Nice  surprise, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Here. This'll pay for a  course in karate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws some money on the bed. Keith tries to kick it  off, but it's too painful. He clutches his testicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank said you were a shit and he  was bloody well right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter turns to leave.  Keith continues, crying and angry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You even screwed his wife, didn't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
