dialogues.text: Carter shuts the door, leaving Keith shouting after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The poor bastard didn't even know  if the kid was his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls back on to the bed, crying out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide road runs alongside the Tyne. It passes below the  vast steel bridges that link the two parts of the city. A carpark lies at the foot of the 'Iron Bridge'. Carter pul up and parks. He gets out and moves quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge is a, massive structure. The traffic lanes are flanked each side by pedestrian walkways. It is here that Carter and Margaret have arranged to meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How were things between you and  Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was all right to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing more? Just another feller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicer than most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was just another feller,  wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though nicer than most?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I can't help the way I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the  statement) Why'd you see him so regular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once a week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call that regular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was gentlemanly. I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once a week you like a gentleman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) Look, I'm me, right. You're not.  We are what we are, like it or  not. (She turns and walks  slowly along the  bridge.) Why all the bloody needle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was bugging Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted me to leave Dave and  marry him. Last Friday I told him  it wouldn't work. Dave would have  killed us both! (pause) He followed me home and kicked up  a stink in the street, (pause) I had to tell Frank I couldn't see  him any more. It was getting too  dodgy. That was on Sunday. (She stops and looks  over the bridge.) He said he'd kill himself. I was  frightened what you might do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a moment. Carter shakes his  head. He gently takes the sunglasses from Margaret's face and folds them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you, Margaret.  Frank wasn't like that. (pause) I'm the villain in the family,  remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter snaps her glasses in two and throws them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. Honestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) You bloody whore. Frank was too  careful to die like that. Who killed  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter holds her arm. She winces like she's been hit befo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, the only reason I came  back to this craphole was to find  out who did it. And I won't leave  until I do. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Carter Peter's Jaguar comes slowly along the bridg It stops. The passenger side is a gaping hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter swings round to see them, then swings angrily back to Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bitch! It was you who told  them I was here, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smacks her hard across the face. Margaret cries out.  The car draws alongside. A steel mesh separates the  pedestrian way from the traffic, so the two men can't get to Carter until he reaches the end of the bridge. Con lea out, his usual cheery self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's very upset about his car.  He's going to shit all over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch up with you later,  Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that he vaults over the handrail on to a corruga roof. Con jumps out of the Jaguar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts above the  revs) Come on, get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Con does and they race off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter arrives at the top of some narrow, steep, overgrow steps leading down to the river road, where his car is  parked. He leaps down the steps as the Jaguar screeches t a halt at the top. Con leaps out of the Jaguar and gives  chase. Peter backs the Jaguar and roars off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter comes running down the steps with Con not far behi He arrives at the river road. In the distance, he can see his parked car.    As he nears the car park, Peter's Jaguar comes down the  hill. It's going to cut Carter off from his car. A Sunbeam Alpine sports car waits there. Its engine roars into life and it races out of the car park. It reaches hi just before the Jaguar and slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter sees that the driver is GLENDA. The hood is down,  so he vaults into the car as it accelerates off. The Sunbeam swings round, narrowly missing the oncoming  Jaguar, and roars away. Peter hasn't a chance. He's facin the wrong way and has little room to manoeuvre. Glenda laughs as the car swings wildly around a corner at the top of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every movement Glenda makes is sexually charged manual  gear changes, steering, even braking. Carter can't take  his eyes off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know you had a fairy  godmother, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I didn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fairy godmother, all of your  own. Aren't you lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are we going, Princess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the demon king's castle, of  course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Where else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car screams off the road into a multi-storey carpark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda really puts her foot down. The car hurtles around  each deserted floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know where I'd be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were seen parking your car.  The demon king waves his wand and  I was dispatched to bring you to  him. Lucky for you I waited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very lucky, I should think. You're  drunk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have been pretty sure I'd  come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he was. He told me a magic  spell that would make you come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) And what was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brakes to a split-second stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one large empty concrete box with big picture window all the way round. Wires are hanging from the ceiling and walls where the lights will eventually be fixed. A tall figure stands at the opposite end, facing the sett sun. He is just a silhouette. Carter and Glenda enter and walk towards the man. The  silhouette turns as he nears it. It's Brumby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new venture of mine. It's going  to be a restaurant. (pause) Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, after you'd gone, I  did a little bit of asking around.  Seeing as you weren't very  forthcoming, (pause) It seems that you are concerned  about the death of your brother?   (pause) I got to thinking it would  be nice if the bloke you were after  was the same bloke I wanted off my  back, (pause) You know my life. Machines. The  arcades. Nice business. Looks after  itself. People put money in. I  take it out. Not much rough stuff.  It's a business that makes me very  happy. But recently, I've had a  spot of bother, (pause) One of my lads gets a bit over- anxious and flogs some machines in  a club that's already got some.  The upshot is I've had to eat shit  and stop flogging my machines to  other clubs. (pause) So far as I'm concerned, that's  it. Apparently not. These people  I've offended get the idea that it  would be good to take over my whole  outfit, (pause) So I'm worried. I can't fight them   I haven't that kind of set-up.  But I've got to fix them before  they fix me. Trouble is, if I try  and they find out, I'm dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby picks up a black briefcase. He holds it up to Cart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five grand. It belongs to you.  Along with a little name I'm going  to give you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear. Cyril Kinnear. (pause) Kinnear did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. All I know is that  people were shitting bricks up at  his place last Saturday. Your  brother's name was mentioned. Next  day, he was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. That's all I was  told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes a last look at Glenda and walks slowly back  towards the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Do me a favour. You don't really  expect me to fix Kinnear on your  say-so? (pause) Just because they tried to get me  on you last night, don't think you  can pull the same trick. Stroll  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Mr Brumby. Carter  exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter steps out of the elevator as Glenda's Sunbeam come down the bottom ramp fast. The car brakes hard and stops. Carter opens the door and gets in. Not a word is said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is one of many in a modern block and Glenda has only recently moved in. There is a mattress on the  floor. A large mirror leans against the wall behind it an a film projector stands close to the window, which has  makeshift curtains. Carter and Glenda are on the mattress. The bedding is all over the place. They have just finished fucking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Who's setting you up in this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. He's meeting the  architects at the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter plays with her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you scared Kinnear will  find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't. He thinks I'm simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter kisses her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want that bloody great  country place for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowingly) Entertaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of entertaining?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter looks at the film projector by the bed and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Brumby get a kick out of that  crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling) Especially when I play the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter wraps his arms about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Kinnear say anything? After  I'd left the other night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda sits up sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you waited for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her on the  neck) Not entirely. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda pushes him away and gets out of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda leaves for the bathroom. Carter, curious, looks at the film projector. It's loaded. He switches it on. A bea of light hits the opposite wall. He settles down to watch the film. The leader flashes by, then a title being chalk on a school blackboard 'The Teacher's Pet'.  A zoom back  reveals Glenda, bare-breasted, holding the chalk. This is followed by a long shot of a young girl, dressed in schoo uniform, waiting at a bus stop. A car approaches and stop A woman driver offers the girl a lift. The woman is  Margaret. The identity of the girl not revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda is in the bath. Lots of foam. The hot water is sti running.  She's smoking. She leans forward, turning off  the tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is sitting up on the mattress, amused by the soft  porn unfolding on the white wall in front of him. The schoolgirl accepts the lift and the car drives off.  The door to an anonymous apartment opens and Margaret com in with the girl. Her school hat still hides her identity Glenda is there to greet them. The girl is very awkward. Glenda tries to make her relax, sitting her down and showing her a magazine. Glenda brings her into a bedroom. She takes her own top  off and goes to do the same with the girl. She takes her  hat off. A close-up shows that it is Doreen. Carter tenses but never flinches from what's happening in the film.  Margaret comes into the bedroom and feigns sho at what she sees. She slaps Glenda and they start fightin eventually rolling off the bed. The apartment door opens and a man smoking a big cigar  comes in. Carter sits up. It's Albert Swift. Albert opens another door, looking for someone. He leaves Another door opens and he's in the bedroom. He sees the  two women fighting on the floor, but on the bed is his  prize Doreen.  Carter watches. Doreen bites her nails and looks terrified. Reflected in  the mirror behind Carter is the image of Albert taking of his trousers. The reel runs out and flaps like a fish.  Carter doesn't move. Tears form in his eyes. He looks old and defeated. His is a wasted life. Then the anger that  drives him explodes again and he throws back the bedcloth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, now dressed, moves slowly towards her in the bath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to give you an Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) You've been watching the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl. Who pulled her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it one of Kinnear's films?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who set it up?  Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he must have pulled her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expect so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did my brother Frank find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother? What you talking  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's fury bursts. He's out of control. He seizes Glen and plunges her under the bathwater, holding her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lying bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter lifts her up, out of the water. She is spluttering nearly drowned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl's name was Doreen. That's  all I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't know her last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's Carter. That's my name, (pause) And her father was my brother. And  he was murdered last Sunday. Now  get up and get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes her ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter manhandles Glenda towards her Sunbeam. He opens th boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenda climbs in and he slams the boot shut. The car  scorches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter parks the sports car as the ferry docks. He moves  down the gangway towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl with a baby in a pram is having a cup of tea. The  door slams open. There's Carter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is numb with fear, unable to answer. Carter grab her by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl is frozen with terror. He lets go as suddenly as he grabbed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where I'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter walks fast. There's the sound of a phone being  dialled. It's the GIRL in the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, he's come for Albert, (pause) I don't know, (pause) On the ferry,  I reckon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter reaches the front of a betting shop. He walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter closes the door. Race results and odds are coming  over the Tannoy. He moves into the shop until he reaches  ALBERT SWIFT. Albert is making out a betting slip and  doesn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Albert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert looks like he's going to be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jack, (snivelling) I don't know anything, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do, Albert. Talk or I'll  kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter sees a door at the back. There's a sign for the  toilets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go to the toilet,  Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first Albert doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go to the toilet,  Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time it clicks. Albert moves to the door and Carter  follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter turns to close the door. Albert runs for it. He  reaches the high double-gate at the end. It's locked and  he tries to climb it. No luck. Carter easily pulls him  down. Albert faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't get away from me, Albert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels for his cigarettes but can't find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, give us a fag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes out his cigarettes. Albert takes one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know who Doreen was.  Thought she was just another bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Eric Pake pull her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. He's got his ways. He  knows Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of weeks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No choice. I had a visit from  somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff Brumby. He'd seen the film.  He wanted to meet Doreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you told Brumby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who killed Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert doesn 't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to be dead, Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last Sunday afternoon, Eric and  two of his boys arrive with Frank  and tell me that he's rumbled.  Somehow, he's seen the film and  was about to shoot his mouth off.  They ask me for some whisky and  start forcing it down his throat. (pause) I thought they'd just duff him up  a bit. Honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?  Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. What could I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Eric know that Frank was my  brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Good.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert draws deeply on his cigarette. They drove Frank away in a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all there is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's it, Albert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter takes something from his pocket. There's a loud  click.  It's a. knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, for Christ's sake ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew what I'd do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Yes, but listen. Christ, I didn't  kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter drives the knife into him with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you didn't kill him. (and again.) I know you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ship's horn calls mournfully from the harbour. Albert  leans back. Blood seeps from his chest. He pitches forwar twitches, and is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter comes in from the back and walks calmly through to the street. A blind man is at the counter placing a bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sunbeam waits in the car park. Eric, Con and Peter  arrive in the Land Rover and park behind it. They go down the gangplank to the floating jetty. A ferry is chugging  across the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter sits, watching the other passengers. A mother and  two young children take his attention. His look is tinted with regret even remorse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ferry comes alongside, Eric, Con and Peter move up to the rail. The passengers disembark, leaving Carter  standing alone.  He's holding Con's handgun. Eric, Con and Peter hack slowly away to the steel shelter Peter, impatient as ever, pulls a sawn-off automatic shoo from under his coat, cocks it and fires. Too late. Carter is already safely behind the ferry's superstructure. Eric shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shooters. Cyril said no shooters,  you stupid bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get stuffed.  He's reloading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerald wants to see him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is listening to all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Are you coming in? Or do we piss  about all day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're finished, Jack. You know  that, don't you? I've bloody  finished you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not till I'm dead, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've still got your sense of  humour?  Tell him how I've fixed  him, Con.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's told Gerald about you and  Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't believe us at first, did  he, Con? Then Peter talked to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't even say goodbye. Just asked  us to take you back - alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably talking to her right  now. Are you still going to fancy  her when Gerald's finished with  her face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter shows no emotion. Or are his eyes just that bit  sadder?  Peter lets rip again. Another window is shattere Carter ducks back, allowing Peter time to board the ferry Carter catches a glimpse of Peter as he climbs up the  ferry's superstructure to the roof. By the time he heaves himself into position, Carter is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is helpless, clinging to the roof, unable to even  raise his shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long pause while Carter looks at him, then he  cold-bloodedly shoots. Peter is blown away. By the time h hits the deck, he's dead.   Con and Eric panic. They run up the gangplank, safely out of range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, your car needs a wash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric signals to the driver in the Land Rover to bump the  Sunbeam into the water. Two hits and the task is done.   Glenda's screams are lost as the river wraps itself aroun the sinking car. Carter watches impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's hire car corners at speed into the high-rise  carpark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby and two architects in a site meeting. Plans are  laid out on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want them cooking in here.  You can put a hatch in that wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's all a question of ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a car screeching up the ramps interrupts him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who in Christ's name is that? It's  a bloody madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides away to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby comes out to the top tier. On the floor below,  Carter, unseen by Brumby, has parked and is now making fo the concrete spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brumby pounds down to the first level. Carter comes aroun the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter slams his fist hard into his gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have shown the film  to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to. It was the only way I  could get at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a combined shop and post office. Carter is on the  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy on the swing-bridge? (pause) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter hangs up. He takes a can of film from his pocket  and slips it into a large envelope.  At the counter two  women are talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know how it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far did he fall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Betty say... Ninety floors,  I think it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. Was he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The envelope is passed across to the post office assistan It is addressed to Vice Squad, Scotland Yard, London Sw1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better to go quick like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge steel superstructure pivots on a large man-made  island in the middle of the river. On top is a structure not unlike a small lighthouse, from which a man operates the bridge. Carter climbs the outsid ladder. A man waits for him at the top. The man hands him a small cloth package. Carter opens it. Inside is heroin and a hypodermic. He wraps it up again  and hands over an envelope. The man checks the money as  Carter disappears down the outside ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall is crowded. The compere calls the numbers. The  atmosphere is tense as the audience look at their cards.  Someone calls, 'Bingo.' A buzz goes round the hall as  everybody starts talking again. Carter enters, surveying the audience. Eventually, his  eyes alight on the person he's been looking for Margaret. She's involved with a woman friend and doesn't see him.  The next game starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds of people come pouring out. It's the end of the  evening's entertainment. Margaret walks out with her frie Carter follows them and turns up a side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is deserted. Margaret and her friend descend th steps. The clop of their high heels is the only sound.  Carter follows discreetly. At the bottom, Margaret and he friend chat for a moment and part. Carter follows Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clop of Margaret's shoes is heard in the distance. Sh appears. Carter is following behind. He slips into anothe dark alley to get ahead of her. As she reaches her home  Carter's arm shoots out from behind a pillar. It's holdin Con's handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come for you, Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a big party going on. The music is loud. It's mai rich-looking middle-aged men and young dolly birds.  Different things are obviously going on in different room in the house. Dancing in one room, blue movies in another etc. Kinnear flits from one to another. Eric Paice is on  the phone. He puts the receiver down and crosses to Kinne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerald Fletcher wants a word with  you Cyril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear crosses to the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Gerald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stands in the dimly lit kiosk with Margaret. The  hire car is parked alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Carter. Listen carefully, you  hairy-faced git. I've got the film  and enough evidence to put you  away for a long time. All it takes  is one call to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (pause) So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter into phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do a simple deal with you.  All I want is ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear is still listening to Carter. He looks over at  Eric, who's fixing a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. I think that can be arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear continues listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter into phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but I don't want him there  until six in the morning.  OK? (pause) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter hangs up. He pushes Margaret towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise of the wild party is heard off. Eric comes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something, Cyril?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Eric. A word with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights, through the thick trees, as Carter's car come bouncing over rough ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stops in a clearing and leaves his headlights on.  He turns to Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Margaret get out. They appear in the beam of  the headlights and move further into the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter and Margaret stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret is confused.  Take your clothes off.  Margaret  does just that: coat, blouse, skin. She goes to remove he knickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your pants on. (pause) Lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again she obeys. He kneels on her, pinning her arms with his knees, then  stuffs a gag in her mouth. He takes out the hypodermic, places it against her arm,  and injects the heroin into her. She struggles, her eyes  moving frantically about. She screams, but its muffled by the gag.  Carter holds her down and she quickly goes unde Carter removes the gag. He stands, picks her up and walks into the darkness with Margaret in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear is alone, speaking on the telephone quietly. The  party is still going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to listen very carefully.  Jack Carter, (pause) You know what he looks like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bedside light is on. A man in bed is listening on the  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps his cigarette against the ashtray. On his middle  finger is a large ring with the initial 'J' on it. He  listens until the line goes dead. The woman beside him stirs. He stubs out the cigarette an switches off the light. Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric comes out of the front door. Inside the party is sti in progress. He gets into a Cadillac and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is parked where he can see the drive up to Kinnear house. The Cadillac appears and swings on to the road. There's the sound of a phone being dialled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of police cars move slowly up the drive,  followed by a police bus. They park by the front door and around fifty policemen pour out. They move silently aroun the building. A chief constable opens the front door and  walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police move through the house and grounds. In the  bedrooms they find groups of people in bed together. The  men in particular protest and are obviously concerned abo being identified. The police find evidence of drugs,  pornography and so on. Outside, police are combing the grounds. In the long gras leading down to the lake they find women's clothes. They  follow the trail until they discover a woman floating nak face downwards, in the lake. A policeman with waders goes in and pulls her to the side. As others heave her out, we see that it's Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is surrounded by police measuring and  photographing, and outside the house are police cars and  ambulances.  The lawn is crowded with the party crowd. In the early-morning light, they look like dolls. Kinnear comes out of the front door with two plain-clothe officers and gets in a police car. Sirens going, it comes down the short drive to the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is driving along a coast road. The sea and a wide  beach lie on his right. Long rows of houses are to his  left. The sun is still low. It's very quiet. He arrives at a  harbour and drives on until he reaches the end of a vast  wooden jetty running out into the estuary. It's a coal  loader for tankers. This jetty is very high, a complex of wooden staves and  pillars, interwoven with steps and gangways. On its top  tier is a complex of railway lines, signals and black coa chutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter parks his car and picks up the shotgun and a bottl of Scotch off the back seat. He get out and walks over to the jetty and along a lower gangway. At the far end, a ma is standing. It's Eric Paice. Eric turns around abruptly. He sees Carter and disappears up the nearest stairway.  Carter follows. At the top he stops to listen, but can see and hear only  the harbour waters lapping below. Carter looks back to the coal jetty, just in time to see  Eric scamper down to the level below. Eric sprints for th roadway. Carter waits and then starts running directly  above him. Eric keeps running. Carter stays always overhead. He's  playing cat and mouse with Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) You couldn't win an egg and spoon  race, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheezing) Sod off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paice darts down another staircase to ground level and  makes for the roadway. Carter stops above the roadway.  Below, Paice makes for the parked car. Carter holds the  gun up. Eric stops and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from the car or I'll  blow you apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric darts under the jetty. Carter runs on down the steps He can see Eric scampering along the row of cottages towa the beach. Carter starts after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric runs out on to the beach. The only sounds are his  feet pounding the pebbles and his hurtful panting. In the distance, factory chimneys belch out smoke.  Carte appears. For a moment he watches Eric stumbling along at  the far end of the beach. He climbs down to the beach and starts running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter is gaining on Eric rapidly. Eric looks round and  panics. He stumbles and falls over. He gets to his feet quickly and disappears round the  headland. Carter follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the headland, the scene is  extraordinary. The deserted beach is like the edge of the world. The sand is black as far as the eye can see. It's  littered with rubbish. Several old lorries are sunk deep  in the sand. High, grass-covered cliffs flank it on the  left. It's deserted. In the distance, a continuous line of giant black buckets move, like cable-cars, out to sea, before they deposit  their load of coal slag and move inland again. The coal  mine itself is inland, hidden away behind the cliffs. The sea, like the sand, is black as it crashes on to the shor Eric is half-way along the beach, struggling in the mud.  Carter closes on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric nears the line of buckets and cuts inland towards th mine.  Carter has nearly caught up. The buckets grind and crash as they move along the cable. Eric scrambles up the narrow valley down which the coal  slag travels. He is panting horribly. Carter is close on  his heels.  Near the top, where the buckets are practical at ground level, Eric stumbles and falls. He is too  exhausted to get up. Carter stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting slightly) Stand up, Eric. Stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric just manages it. Carter pulls the bottle of Scotch  out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you could use a drink, could  you, Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the bottle to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh? Have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still got your sense of humour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric takes the cap off and looks at Carter. He's in a  terrible state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up, Eric. Drink up. I want  you to drink all of that. Do you  understand? Drink up. Just like it  was with my brother, Frank. Go on,  son. Drink up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric pours the whisky into his month. It spills over and  runs down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric begins to stagger about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you who poured it down him.  Eh, Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric takes a breather and looks pathetically at Carter. N mercy there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you all have a good laugh, eh?  Did you have a good laugh when he  was spewing it up? The whisky is  pouring all over Eric's face and  suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disgusting to watch. Suddenly, he retches, but nothi comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink it! Drink it! Did you all  pass the bottle round after the  car went over the top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric is choking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter leans forward and with his free hand lifts the bot up to Eric's mouth again. In the other, he holds the  shotgun.  Eric chokes and retches. Carter has seen enough

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter raises the butt of the gun and brings it down on  Eric's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric's body, loaded on to a a coal bucket, moves off on  it's final journey. Carter, laughing, walks beside it, gu riding on his shoulder. The bucket shudders and grinds as it moves along the cable. Eric's body moves of on its fin journey. It reaches the end of the line, where an automat catch tilts it. Eric's body drops into the sea. The coal  slag follows in a cloud of black dust. The waves pass ove and everything is gone. Carter stands for a moment, turns and walks back along th beach. He stops, looks at the shotgun, and decides to get rid of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, Carter moves slowly by the edge of the sea. He rai the shotgun to throw it away. High on the clifftop a rifl and telescopic lens line up on Carter. A finger curls aro the trigger. On the middle finger of the same hand is a  large gold ring with the letter 'J' engraved upon it. It  is the man Kinnear contacted after sending Eric to his  death.  The finger tightens on the trigger and pulls it. There's quiet, whooshing sound. Carter drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter lies on the beach. The waves lap around his head. small trickle of blood pours out of a hole in his temple. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinnear's hit man coolly dismantles his rifle. He careful wraps it in a cloth fishing-rod carrier. He walks off and is soon lost as he drops out of sight.
